alert.note: Alert for Northern Warren; Northern Washington; Southeast Warren; Southern Washington (New York) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albany (Eastern New York and Western New England)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued December 13 at 4:03PM EST by NWS Albany
info.description: ...A SNOW SHOWER WILL AFFECT PARTS OF NORTHERN WASHINGTON...SOUTHERN WASHINGTON...SOUTHEAST WARREN...NORTHERN WARREN...AND BENNINGTON COUNTIES... HAZARDS...A snow shower accompanied by winds of up to 30 MPH which can rapidly reduce visibility to less than one mile. LOCATION AND MOVEMENT...At 359 PM EST, a snow shower was near Glens Falls North, or near Lake George Village moving east at 40 MPH. THE SNOW SHOWER WILL BE NEAR...Glens Falls and Hudson Falls around 405 PM EST...Hartford around 415 PM EST...and Pawlet around 425 PM EST. This includes Interstate 87 between exits 18 and 22. SAFETY INFO... Use extra caution if you must travel into or through this snow shower. Rapid changes in visibility and potentially slick roads may lead to accidents. Conditions can deteriorate rapidly in winter weather situations. Be prepared for snow or ice covered roads. Slow down and allow extra time to reach your destination. &&

area.areaDesc: Northern Warren; Northern Washington; Southeast Warren; Southern Washington
